channel.title: iPad game my co-workers and I made
channel.description:
Simple memory game for iPad that me and my co-workers created. So everyone who owns an iPad I would really appreciate your downloads and those 5-star ratings. :D
http://itunes.apple.com/gb/app/fliptiles/id501326142?mt=8&ign-mpt=uo%3D2

item.title: iPad game my co-workers and I made
item.dc:creator: @Blunts_n_Bricks Blunts n Bricks
item.description:
@Blunts_n_Bricks wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:19, topic:433141”]Uhm… Currently:

iPad specific games (does include universal binaries):
13 out of 20 of the top paid applications are games.
2 out of 20 of the top paid applications are ‘utilities’.
The rest are entertainment or educational/reference applications that can’t easily be categorised under games, but are certainly not utilities.

iPhone specific games (also includes universal binaries):
13 out of 20 of the top paid applications are games.
3 out of 20 of the top paid applications are ‘utilities’.
The rest are entertainment or educational/reference applications that can’t easily be categorised under games, but are certainly not utilities.

TL;DR: Games dominate the top paid charts on the platform that generates the most revenue for third party application development. That, and that games are typically more expensive than utilities does pretty much confirm that games are the biggest earner for smartphones & tablets at the moment.[/quote]
Sure, but most of those games are made by big companies. As an independent dev you have almost no chance at cracking the top 25 with a game. Creating some kind of utility or tool brings in easier profits.

I have easily cracked high profits daily - not $3000+ a day as in top 25, but decent daily profits by making some kind of utilities/tools.

Read full topic
item.source: iPad game my co-workers and I made

item.title: iPad game my co-workers and I made
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Uhm… Currently:

iPad specific games (does include universal binaries):
13 out of 20 of the top paid applications are games.
2 out of 20 of the top paid applications are ‘utilities’.
The rest are entertainment or educational/reference applications that can’t easily be categorised under games, but are certainly not utilities.

iPhone specific games (also includes universal binaries):
13 out of 20 of the top paid applications are games.
3 out of 20 of the top paid applications are ‘utilities’.
The rest are entertainment or educational/reference applications that can’t easily be categorised under games, but are certainly not utilities.

TL;DR: Games dominate the top paid charts on the platform that generates the most revenue for third party application development. That, and that games are typically more expensive than utilities does pretty much confirm that games are the biggest earner for smartphones & tablets at the moment.

Read full topic

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:12, topic:433141”][quote author=tL link=topic=535862.msg3922122#msg3922122 date=1329819445]
subjective C

hehe
[/quote]
“I think there should be a programming language called Subjective-C. Boolean operations would return different results depending on who was using your program.”[/quote]

Also known as NAT-C?

Oooh, don’t you just love my wit?

Read full topic
